page.title: 19INVERURIE-PORT CROSSING
page.content:
Due to the heavy flow of traffic through Inverurie there has been a lot of concern about the dangers of crossing the road in the Port. (Port Elphinstone is referred to locally as the Port)
A traffic census carried out by pupils in Port Elphinstone School showed that on average 350 vehicles passed in an hour. At peak times this is greatly increased. It is very difficult to cross the road and there are a lot of elderly people in the community as well as young children.
A petition was circulated asking people to support the construction of a Pelican Crossing. This was then sent to Malcolm Bruce, the M.P. A reply had been received from Mr. Bruce but no plans for the crossing have been made.
